pullRequest.body:
- Define additive contents and prove their basic properties on (semi)-rings of sets.
- Define rings of sets.

Co-authored-by: Peter Pfaffelhuber <p.p@stochastik.uni-freiburg.de>

Part of the formalization of the Kolmogorov Extension Theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7572534346/job/20622592433)

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7572534346/job/20622592745)
Looks okay to me but I don't have time to check things properly and sign it off. Maybe @sgouezel can?
Looks okay to me but I don't have time to check things properly and sign it off. Maybe @sgouezel can?
What's the long-term goal here? Are you planning to redefine `Content` using `AddContent`? Can you record that as a TODO?

```suggestion
* `MeasureTheory.AddContent C`: additive contents over the set of sets `C`.
```
for the docs

```suggestion
Let `m` be an `AddContent C`. If `C` is a set semiring (`IsSetSemiring C`) we have the properties
```

```suggestion
* `AddContent.le_sdiff`: `m s - m t ≤ m (s \ t)`
```

```suggestion
  add' (I : Finset (Set α)) (_h_ss : ↑I ⊆ C) (_h_dis : PairwiseDisjoint (I : Set (Set α)) id)
      (_h_mem : ⋃₀ ↑I ∈ C) : toFun (⋃₀ I) = ∑ u in I, toFun u
```

```suggestion
protected lemma le_sdiff (m : AddContent C) (hC : IsSetRing C) (hs : s ∈ C) (ht : t ∈ C) :
```

```suggestion
  union_mem \{{s t\}} : s ∈ C → t ∈ C → s ∪ t ∈ C
  diff_mem \{{s t\}} : s ∈ C → t ∈ C → s \ t ∈ C
```

Can you not use `where` notation?
```suggestion
lemma isSetSemiring (hC : IsSetRing C) : IsSetSemiring C where
```
Too many linebreaks

```suggestion
@[ext] protected lemma ext {m m' : AddContent C} (h : ∀ s, m s = m' s) : m = m' := FunLike.ext _ _ h
```

```suggestion
  FunLike.ext_iff
```

```suggestion
@[simp] protected lemma apply_empty {m : AddContent C} : m ∅ = 0 := m.empty'
```
or
```suggestion
@[simp] protected lemma meas_empty {m : AddContent C} : m ∅ = 0 := m.empty'
```
would fit better the existing conventions around `Measure`, maybe?
This is a weird name since the statement doesn't mention `+` at all! Shouldn't it mention `sUnion` instead?

Okay this is a possibly even more confusing name now. It sounds like you're saying that a union is equal to a sum, but of course what you're really saying is that the **image** of a union is equal to a sum (of the images). I think you won't get away with avoiding `apply` or `meas` in the name.
I don't really want to prefix all names in the file with `apply`, though. How about I just call that `addContent.sUnion`?
I can't see this being a good design guessability-wise and discoverability-wise. Mind bringing that on Zulip?
How about I name these lemma the same way it is done for measures: instead of `AddContent.sUnion`, I get it out of the namespace and call it `addContent_sUnion`.
That's definitely an improvement, but do know that lemmas like `m (a ∩ b) + m (a ∪ b) = m a + m b` will need to be called `addContent_inter_add_addContent_union` (which I think is alright)
If I was naming something as ubiquitous as a measure that would indeed be an issue, but this addContent should not see much use. A few long names is fine.

Thinking about it more, shouldn't this be spelled 
```suggestion
    (hs : s ∈ C) (hI : ↑I ⊆ C) (hI_ss : ∀ t ∈ I, t ⊆ s)
```
and elsewhere too?
Indeed the simp lemma [Set.sUnion_subset_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Lattice.html#Set.sUnion_subset_iff) says your suggestion should be preferred.

```suggestion
    ⋃ i ∈ S, s i ∈ C := by
```
hopefully works
can't this property be deduced from `sUnion'` (by taking the empty set)? If so, remove it from the definition, and prove it separately.
That only works if the empty set is in C. I'd rather not have conditions on C in the definition of AddContent.

```suggestion
lemma addContent_union' (hs : s ∈ C) (ht : t ∈ C) (hst : s ∪ t ∈ C) (h_dis : Disjoint s t) :
```
Is that really possible? compact sets don't form a semiring of sets, right?

Right. Content is an AddContent, but if I only prove properties of AddContent on semi-rings of sets I can't use any of that to deduce properties of Content since compacts are not a semi-ring of sets. I'll just remove that todo.

You can use `induction'` here to avoid reverting. Something like
```
  induction' S using Finset.induction with a S ha ih
```
Same thing elsewhere.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory): define contents on semi-rings of sets
